page.title: 20FOLKLORE & FESTIVALS
page.content: Cornwall is the home of many myths and legends. It is supposedly the home of the pixie - or 'piskey' - as they are locally known. Many standing stones abound in the County, although none in our block. East Cornwall is similar in landscape, attitudes, and customs as those found in Devon the land across the County border, the River Tamar. A Honey Fair is held annually at the nearby town of Callington, and a Cherry Feast held at St. Mellion, bordering Landulph Parish. There is a Carnival held every year in Landulph and every two years a flower festival organised by local market gardeners. The oldest building in our block is the Landulph Parish Church, in which is buried the last of the Roman Emperors.
